thread.title: Drunkenly Play Pop Star at These 12 Karaoke Bars
thread.title_full: Drunkenly Play Pop Star at These 12 Karaoke Bars

author: Eater Staff
title: Drunkenly Play Pop Star at These 12 Karaoke Bars
text:
Drunkenly Play Pop Star at These 12 Karaoke Bars All Feb 21, 2017, 11:52am PST Alibi Tiki Lounge Facebook/Alibi 
Cocktails and karaoke go together like Hall and Oates. So what better way to celebrate your inner pop star than by raising a glass and taking the mic? Most people need a little extra lubrication to get up the nerve anyway, and the songs always sound best when you're too tipsy to care. 
We put together a list of Portland karaoke bars that can satisfy your ballad-blasting needs no matter what mood you're in. And if you want to take your party on the road, there's the Old School PDX karaoke bus, tricked out with a karaoke sound system, dance floor, and party lights. 
But here's a pro tip: Steer clear of the Whitney and Adele songs. They never sound like you think they will, no matter how many martinis you've had. (Note: The points on this map guide are not ranked; rather, they're organized geographically.) 
â€” Michelle DeVona and Cassy Sawyer 1 Chopsticks 3 
This beloved Chinese restaurant might have the win for quirkiest karaoke in town. Crowds belt out their favorite tunes seven nights a week, but on Mondays a group of singers brings their puppets along. Note the restaurant's other location, Chopsticks (formerly Chopsticks 2), has moved to NE 33rd and Sandy Blvd.
